text: Edgard Pisani (; 9 October 1918 – 20 June 2016) was a French statesman, philosopher, and writer. He held positions in various governments in France: Senator (1954–1961; 1974–1981), Minister of Agriculture (1961–1966), Parliamentarian (1967–1968), European Commissioner (1981–1985), Minister of New Caledonia (1985), President of the Arab World Institute (1988–1995). In 1992, with Bertrand Hervieu, he formed the Groupe de Seillac followed in 1995 by the Groupe de Bruges, both being think tanks. ==References== Category:1918 births Category:2016 deaths Category:20th-century French philosophers Category:21st-century philosophers Category:French writers Category:Government ministers of France Category:People from Tunis Category:20th-century writers Category:21st-century writers
title: Edgard Pisani
